.... It's not just Kled. Anyone that gets hit by {{champion:99}} Q that isn't a tank is pretty much blown to smithereens. It's not just Kled rito... everyone is victim to this double-rainbow psychopath.

The thing with that is, that, at the moment the trending champions are fast, flashy champions with dashes and invulnerabilities like {{champion:157}} and {{champion:236}} ...it's damn near impossible to hit these guys with skillshots, let alone the fact that yasuo has a freakin' windwall which blocks her Q.
But that's not just it, season 6 is a very fast, dashy season....{{summoner:6}} had it's cooldown lowered, {{item:3152}} got added, {{item:3100}} had its passive movespeed buffed, combined with {{item:3285}} it makes mages very quick. {{item:3742}}  can make anyone into a super-speedy skillshot dodger...
My point is, in season 6, nobody should be letting themselves get hit by skillshots that travel as slowly as Light Binding, it's a real frustration when you play lux - as soon as people get tier 2 boots it becomes frustratingly easy for them to dodge Light Binding. (I don't mean juke, I don't mean Lux just missing, I mean, Lux being on-point with her aiming but her target can literally dodge the skillshot before it hits them).
Lux's Light Binding is an outright underpowered ability at the moment, and when it goes on cooldown she dies because it's her only hard CC and her only good defensive option. If you're letting yourself get hit by light binding in season 6 then you deserve to die anyway, because it's not hard to do with all of these movespeed buffs lying around.

Is riot just smashing out champions for the sake of it? It seems like each new champ released is just stealing abilities from what's already available from other kits! Instead of getting a bunch of new champions with new abilities that might bring about change to the meta and make things interesting, lets keep flogging off what we already have and keep the meta the same boring meta for another year.

Hey Rito. Just wanted to point out that in the last video about team fighting and late game, Kled did absolutely nothing except give {{champion:1}} a move speed buff so she could stun all of them and drop a gigantic bear on them. He did absolutely no damage. :)

Well to be fair, he's a "single-target slayer" that dumped his entire damage pool into a Kayle ulti, so we've got no real clue what his ACTUAL damage potential is. And besides, sometimes giving endgame Annie a speed boost is all the teamwork you need.

But yes, not the best vid pick by Riot to showcase Kled's awesome[Citation needed] ganking power.
So, your saying Kled is bad late game?
i feel like it was more : he kept them interested - i.e. in that bush - so annie could use the speed boost and then drop a bear on them.
